chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: R
a: R
n: nat
x: R

Goal:
a <= x <= b -> {i : nat | nth 0 (unif_part a b n) i <= x < nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size (unif_part a b n))%nat} + {nth 0 (unif_part a b n) n <= x <= nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S n)}

Premises:
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
unif_part = fun (a b : R) (n : nat) => mkseq (fun i : nat => a + INR i * (b - a) / (INR n + 1)) (S (S n)) : R -> R -> nat -> seq R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope nat_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
unif_part_sort : forall (a b : R) (n : nat), a <= b -> sorted Rle (unif_part a b n)
head_unif_part : forall (x0 a b : R) (n : nat), head x0 (unif_part a b n) = a
last_unif_part : forall (x0 a b : R) (n : nat), last x0 (unif_part a b n) = b
unif_part_bound : forall (a b : R) (n : nat), unif_part a b n = rev (unif_part b a n)
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
Rminus_le_0 : forall a b : R, a <= b < -> 0 <= b - a
Rle_div_l : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a / c <= b < -> a <= b * c
Rminus_lt_0 : forall a b : R, a < b < -> 0 < b - a
Rle_minus_l : forall a b c : R, a - c <= b < -> a <= b + c
Rlt_div_r : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a * c < b < -> a < b / c
sorted_dec : forall (s : seq R) (x0 x : R), sorted Rle s -> head x0 s <= x <= last x0 s -> {i : nat | nth x0 s i <= x < nth x0 s (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size s)%nat} + {nth x0 s (size s - 2) <= x <= nth x0 s (size s - 1)}
Rlt_minus_r : forall a b c : R, a < b - c < -> a + c < b
pointed_subdiv = fun ptd : SF_seq => forall i : nat, (i < SF_size ptd)%nat -> nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_ly ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) (S i) : SF_seq -> Prop
nth_le_seq_step : forall (x0 : R) (l : seq R) (i : nat), (S i < size l)%nat -> Rabs (nth x0 l (S i) - nth x0 l i) <= seq_step l
nth_iota : forall p m n i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth p (seq.iota m n) i = ssrnat.addn m i
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
is_true = fun b : bool => b = true : bool -> Prop Argument scope is [bool_scope] is_true is a coercion
nfloor_ex : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> {n : nat | INR n <= x < INR n + 1}
SF_fun_incr : forall (s : SF_seq) (y0 : ?T) (x0 : R) (Hs : sorted Rle (SF_lx s)) (Hx : head 0 (SF_lx s) <= x0 <= last 0 (SF_lx s)), SF_fun s y0 x0 = match sorted_dec (SF_lx s) 0 x0 Hs Hx with | inleft H => nth y0 (SF_ly s) (proj1_sig H) | inright _ => nth y0 (SF_ly s) (SF_size s - 1) end where ?T : [a : R b : R n : nat x : R |- Type]
nfloor : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> nat
eq_from_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), size s1 = size s2 -> (forall i : nat, ssrnat.leq (S i) (size s1) -> nth x0 s1 i = nth x0 s2 i) -> s1 = s2
sorted_nth : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s : seq ?T), sorted Ord s < -> (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (size s))%nat -> forall x0 : ?T, Ord (nth x0 s i) (nth x0 s (S i))) where ?T : [a : R b : R n : nat x : R |- Type]
nth_rev : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (n : nat) (s : seq T), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x0 (rev s) n = nth x0 s (ssrnat.subn (size s) (S n))
Rinv_le_contravar : forall x y : R, 0 < x -> x <= y -> / y <= / x
pos_Rl = fix pos_Rl (l : Rlist) (i : nat) {struct l} : R := match l with | nil => 0 | cons a l' => match i with | 0%nat => a | S i' => pos_Rl l' i' end end : Rlist -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope]
Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, Z.of_nat (S n) = Z.succ (Z.of_nat n)
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0%nat | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Argument scope is [N_scope]
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
nth_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (x : T) (n : nat), nth x0 (rcons s x) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) then nth x0 s n else if eqtype.eq_op n (size s) then x else x0)

```coq
```coq
intro Hab.
destruct (interval_finite_subdiv a b (Rminus b a / size (unif_part a b n)) Hab) as [l [Hl1 Hl2]].
unfold unif_part, size in Hl2.
rewrite head_unif_part, last_unif_part in Hl2.
apply (sorted_dec (unif_part a b n) 0 x Hl2).
split.
+ intros i H.
  rewrite nth_unif_part, nth_rcons.
  destruct i; try omega.
  rewrite Rmult_0_l, Rplus_0_l.
  apply Rle_refl.
+ apply Rle_refl.
unfold interval_finite_subdiv_between in Hl2.
apply Hl2.
Qed.```
